senses.sense_definition: To communicate ideas, feelings, or information to make them known or understood by others.

examples.text: Her warm smile seemed to <w>convey</w> a sense of welcome to everyone in the room.
Please <w>convey</w> a message to your manager regarding the schedule change.

senses.sense_definition: To move or carry something from one place to another, often through a continuous mechanical process or system.

examples.text: Large underground pipes <w>convey</w> water from the reservoir to the city center.
The factory uses a long belt to <w>convey</w> goods to the packaging area.

senses.sense_definition: To take or carry someone from one location to another.

examples.text: A private carriage was waiting to <w>convey</w> the guests to the wedding venue.
The ambulance arrived quickly to <w>convey</w> the injured man to the hospital.

senses.sense_definition: To transfer the legal title or ownership of property to another person.

examples.text: The signed contract will <w>convey</w> the property title to the new owner immediately.
He decided to <w>convey</w> ownership of the business to his daughter before he retired.
